   19: %%
   20: -module(beam_lib_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: %%-define(debug, true).
   23: 
   24: -ifdef(debug).
   25: -define(format(S, A), io:format(S, A)).
   26: -define(line, put(line, ?LINE), ).
   27: -define(config(X,Y), "./log_dir/").
   28: -define(privdir, "beam_lib_SUITE_priv").
   29: -else.
   30: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   31: -define(format(S, A), ok).
   32: -define(privdir, proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Conf)).
   33: -endif.
   34: 
   35: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   36: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, 
   37: 	 normal/1, error/1, cmp/1, cmp_literals/1, strip/1, strip_add_chunks/1, otp_6711/1,
   38:          building/1, md5/1, encrypted_abstr/1, encrypted_abstr_file/1,
   39:          missing_debug_info_backend/1]).
   40: -export([test_makedep_abstract_code/1]).
   41: 
   42: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   43: 
   44: suite() ->
   45:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   46:      {timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
   47: 
   48: all() -> 
   49:     [error, normal, cmp, cmp_literals, strip, strip_add_chunks, otp_6711,
   50:      building, md5, encrypted_abstr, encrypted_abstr_file,
   51:      missing_debug_info_backend, test_makedep_abstract_code
   52:     ].
   53: 
   54: groups() -> 
   55:     [].
   56: 
   57: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   58:     Config.
   59: 
   60: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   61:     %% Cleanup after strip and strip_add_chunks
   62:     case code:is_sticky(sofs) of
   63:         false ->
   64:             false = code:purge(sofs),
   65:             {module, sofs} = code:load_file(sofs),
   66:             code:stick_mod(sofs),
   67:             ok;
   68:         true ->
   69:             ok
   70:     end.
   71: 
   72: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   73:     Config.
   74: 
   75: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   76:     Config.
   77: 
   78: 
   79: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   80:     Config.
   81: 
   82: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   83:     ok.
   84: 
   85: %% Read correct beam file.
   86: normal(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
   87:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
   88:     Simple = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple"),
   89:     Source = Simple ++ ".erl",
   90:     BeamFile = Simple ++ ".beam",
   91:     simple_file(Source),
   92: 
   93:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
   94:     P0 = pps(),
   95: 
   96:     do_normal(Source, PrivDir, BeamFile, []),
   97: 
   98:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Source, [{outdir,PrivDir}, no_debug_info]),
   99:     {ok, {simple, [{debug_info, {debug_info_v1, erl_abstract_code, {none, _}}}]}} =
  100: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [debug_info]),
  101:     {ok, {simple, [{abstract_code, no_abstract_code}]}} =
  102: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [abstract_code]),
  103: 
  104:     %% {ok,_} = compile:file(Source, [compressed | CompileFlags]),
  105:     %% do_normal(BeamFile),
  106: 
  107:     file:delete(BeamFile),
  108:     file:delete(Source),
  109:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  110:     true = (P0 == pps()),
  111:     ok.
  112: 
  113: do_normal(Source, PrivDir, BeamFile, Opts) ->
  114:     CompileFlags = [{outdir,PrivDir}, debug_info | Opts],
  115:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Source, CompileFlags),
  116:     {ok, Binary} = file:read_file(BeamFile),
  117: 
  118:     do_normal(BeamFile, Opts),
  119:     do_normal(Binary, Opts).
  120: 
  121: do_normal(BeamFile, Opts) ->
  122:     Imports = {imports, [{erlang, get_module_info, 1},
  123: 			 {erlang, get_module_info, 2},
  124: 			 {lists, member, 2}]},
  125:     Exports = {exports, [{module_info, 0}, {module_info, 1}, {t, 0}]},
  126:     Local = {locals, [{t, 1}]},
  127:     {ok, {simple, [Imports]}} = beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [imports]),
  128:     {ok, {simple, [{"ImpT",_Bin}]}} =
  129: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, ["ImpT"]),
  130:     {ok, {simple, [Exports]}} = beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [exports]),
  131:     {ok, {simple, [{attributes, [{vsn, [_]}]}]}} =
  132: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [attributes]),
  133:     {ok, {simple, [{compile_info, _}=CompileInfo]}} =
  134: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [compile_info]),
  135:     {ok, {simple, [Local]}} = beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [locals]),
  136:     {ok, {simple, [{attributes, [{vsn, [_]}]}, CompileInfo,
  137: 		   Exports, Imports, Local]}} =
  138: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [attributes, compile_info, exports, imports, locals]),
  139:     {ok, {simple, [{atoms, _Atoms}]}} =
  140: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [atoms]),
  141:     {ok, {simple, [{labeled_exports, _LExports}]}} =
  142: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [labeled_exports]),
  143:     {ok, {simple, [{labeled_locals, _LLocals}]}} =
  144: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [labeled_locals]),
  145:     {ok, {simple, [_Vsn]}} = beam_lib:version(BeamFile),
  146:     {ok, {simple, [{abstract_code, {_, _}}]}} =
  147: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [abstract_code]),
  148:     {ok, {simple, [{debug_info, {debug_info_v1, erl_abstract_code, _}}]}} =
  149: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [debug_info]),
  150: 
  151:     %% Test reading optional chunks.
  152:     All = ["Atom", "Code", "StrT", "ImpT", "ExpT", "FunT", "LitT", "AtU8"],
  153:     {ok,{simple,Chunks}} = beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, All, [allow_missing_chunks]),
  154:     case {verify_simple(Chunks),Opts} of
  155: 	{{missing_chunk, AtomBin}, []} when is_binary(AtomBin) -> ok;
  156: 	{{AtomBin, missing_chunk}, [no_utf8_atoms]} when is_binary(AtomBin) -> ok
  157:     end,
  158: 
  159:     %% 'allow_missing_chunks' should work for named chunks too.
  160:     {ok, {simple, StrippedBeam}} = beam_lib:strip(BeamFile),
  161:     {ok, {simple, MChunks}} = beam_lib:chunks(StrippedBeam,
  162:                                               [attributes, locals],
  163:                                               [allow_missing_chunks]),
  164:     [{attributes, missing_chunk}, {locals, missing_chunk}] = MChunks,
  165: 
  166:     %% Make sure that reading the atom chunk works when the 'allow_missing_chunks'
  167:     %% option is used.
  168:     Some = ["Code",atoms,"ExpT","LitT"],
  169:     {ok,{simple,SomeChunks}} = beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, Some, [allow_missing_chunks]),
  170:     [{"Code",<<_/binary>>},{atoms,[_|_]},{"ExpT",<<_/binary>>},{"LitT",missing_chunk}] =
  171: 	SomeChunks.
  172: 
  173: verify_simple([{"Atom", PlainAtomChunk},
  174: 	       {"Code", CodeBin},
  175: 	       {"StrT", StrBin},
  176: 	       {"ImpT", ImpBin},
  177: 	       {"ExpT", ExpBin},
  178: 	       {"FunT", missing_chunk},
  179: 	       {"LitT", missing_chunk},
  180: 	       {"AtU8", AtU8Chunk}])
  181:   when is_binary(CodeBin), is_binary(StrBin),
  182:        is_binary(ImpBin), is_binary(ExpBin) ->
  183:     {PlainAtomChunk, AtU8Chunk}.
  184: 
  185: %% Read invalid beam files.
  186: error(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  187:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  188:     Simple = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple"),
  189:     Source = Simple ++ ".erl",
  190:     BeamFile = Simple ++ ".beam",
  191:     WrongFile = Simple ++ "foo.beam",
  192:     simple_file(Source),
  193: 
  194:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  195:     P0 = pps(),
  196:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Source, [{outdir,PrivDir},debug_info]),
  197:     ACopy = filename:join(PrivDir, "a_copy.beam"),
  198:     copy_file(BeamFile, ACopy),
  199: 
  200:     {ok, Binary} = file:read_file(BeamFile),
  201: 
  202:     copy_file(ACopy, WrongFile),
  203:     verify(file_error, beam_lib:info("./does_simply_not_exist")),
  204: 
  205:     do_error(BeamFile, ACopy),
  206:     do_error(Binary, ACopy),
  207: 
  208:     copy_file(ACopy, BeamFile),
  209:     verify(unknown_chunk, beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [not_a_chunk])),
  210: 
  211:     ok = file:write_file(BeamFile, <<>>),
  212:     verify(not_a_beam_file, beam_lib:info(BeamFile)),
  213:     verify(not_a_beam_file, beam_lib:info(<<>>)),
  214:     ok = file:write_file(BeamFile, <<"short">>),
  215:     verify(not_a_beam_file, beam_lib:info(BeamFile)),
  216:     verify(not_a_beam_file, beam_lib:info(<<"short">>)),
  217: 
  218:     {Binary1, _} = split_binary(Binary, byte_size(Binary)-10),
  219:     LastChunk = last_chunk(Binary),
  220:     verify(chunk_too_big, beam_lib:chunks(Binary1, [LastChunk])),
  221:     Chunks = chunk_info(Binary),
  222:     {value, {_, DebugInfoStart, _}} = lists:keysearch("Dbgi", 1, Chunks),
  223:     {Binary2, _} = split_binary(Binary, DebugInfoStart),
  224:     verify(chunk_too_big, beam_lib:chunks(Binary2, ["Dbgi"])),
  225:     {Binary3, _} = split_binary(Binary, DebugInfoStart-4),
  226:     verify(invalid_beam_file, beam_lib:chunks(Binary3, ["Dbgi"])),
  227: 
  228:     %% Instead of the 5:32 field below, there used to be control characters
  229:     %% (including zero bytes) directly in the string. Because inferior programs
  230:     %% such as sed and clearcasediff don't like zero bytes in text files,
  231:     %% we have eliminated them.
  232:     ok = file:write_file(BeamFile, <<"FOR1",5:32,"BEAMfel">>),
  233: 
  234:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  235:     true = (P0 == pps()),
  236:     file:delete(Source),
  237:     file:delete(WrongFile),
  238:     file:delete(BeamFile),
  239:     file:delete(ACopy),
  240:     ok.
  241: 
  242: last_chunk(Bin) ->
  243:     L = beam_lib:info(Bin),
  244:     {chunks,Chunks} = lists:keyfind(chunks, 1, L),
  245:     {Last,_,_} = lists:last(Chunks),
  246:     Last.
  247: 
  248: do_error(BeamFile, ACopy) ->
  249:     %% evil tests
  250:     Chunks = chunk_info(BeamFile),
  251:     {value, {_, AtomStart, _}} = lists:keysearch("AtU8", 1, Chunks),
  252:     {value, {_, ImportStart, _}} = lists:keysearch("ImpT", 1, Chunks),
  253:     {value, {_, DebugInfoStart, _}} = lists:keysearch("Dbgi", 1, Chunks),
  254:     {value, {_, AttributesStart, _}} =
  255: 	lists:keysearch("Attr", 1, Chunks),
  256:     {value, {_, CompileInfoStart, _}} =
  257: 	lists:keysearch("CInf", 1, Chunks),
  258:     verify(missing_chunk, beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, ["__"])),
  259:     BF2 = set_byte(ACopy, BeamFile, ImportStart+4, 17),
  260:     verify(invalid_chunk, beam_lib:chunks(BF2, [imports])),
  261:     BF3 = set_byte(ACopy, BeamFile, AtomStart-6, 17),
  262:     verify(missing_chunk, beam_lib:chunks(BF3, [imports])),
  263:     BF4 = set_byte(ACopy, BeamFile, DebugInfoStart+10, 17),
  264:     verify(invalid_chunk, beam_lib:chunks(BF4, [debug_info])),
  265:     BF5 = set_byte(ACopy, BeamFile, AttributesStart+8, 17),
  266:     verify(invalid_chunk, beam_lib:chunks(BF5, [attributes])),
  267: 
  268:     BF6 = set_byte(ACopy, BeamFile, 1, 17),
  269:     verify(not_a_beam_file, beam_lib:info(BF6)),
  270:     BF7 = set_byte(ACopy, BeamFile, 9, 17),
  271:     verify(not_a_beam_file, beam_lib:info(BF7)),
  272: 
  273:     BF8 = set_byte(ACopy, BeamFile, 13, 17),
  274:     verify(missing_chunk, beam_lib:chunks(BF8, ["AtU8"])),
  275: 
  276:     BF9 = set_byte(ACopy, BeamFile, CompileInfoStart+8, 17),
  277:     verify(invalid_chunk, beam_lib:chunks(BF9, [compile_info])).
  278: 
  279: 
  280: %% Compare contents of BEAM files and directories.
  281: cmp(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  282:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  283: 
  284:     Dir1 = filename:join(PrivDir, "dir1"),
  285:     Dir2 = filename:join(PrivDir, "dir2"),
  286: 
  287:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir1),
  288:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir2),
  289: 
  290:     {SourceD1, BeamFileD1} = make_beam(Dir1, simple, member),
  291:     {Source2D1, BeamFile2D1} = make_beam(Dir1, simple2, concat),
  292:     {SourceD2, BeamFileD2} = make_beam(Dir2, simple, concat),
  293: 
  294:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  295:     P0 = pps(),
  296: 
  297:     %% cmp
  298:     ok = beam_lib:cmp(BeamFileD1, BeamFileD1),
  299:     ver(modules_different, beam_lib:cmp(BeamFileD1, BeamFile2D1)),
  300:     ver(chunks_different, beam_lib:cmp(BeamFileD1, BeamFileD2)),
  301:     verify(file_error, beam_lib:cmp(foo, bar)),
  302: 
  303:     {ok, B1} = file:read_file(BeamFileD1),
  304:     ok = beam_lib:cmp(B1, BeamFileD1),
  305:     {ok, B2} = file:read_file(BeamFileD2),
  306:     ver(chunks_different, beam_lib:cmp(B1, B2)),
  307: 
  308:     %% cmp_dirs
  309:     {[],[],[]} = beam_lib:cmp_dirs(Dir1, Dir1),
  310:     true = {[BeamFile2D1], [], [{BeamFileD1,BeamFileD2}]} ==
  311: 	beam_lib:cmp_dirs(Dir1, Dir2),
  312:     true = {[], [BeamFile2D1], [{BeamFileD2,BeamFileD1}]} ==
  313: 	beam_lib:cmp_dirs(Dir2, Dir1),
  314:     ver(not_a_directory, beam_lib:cmp_dirs(foo, bar)),
  315: 
  316:     %% diff_dirs
  317:     ok = beam_lib:diff_dirs(Dir1, Dir1),
  318:     ver(not_a_directory, beam_lib:diff_dirs(foo, bar)),
  319: 
  320:     true = (P0 == pps()),
  321:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  322:     delete_files([SourceD1, BeamFileD1, Source2D1,
  323: 		  BeamFile2D1, SourceD2, BeamFileD2]),
  324: 
  325:     file:del_dir(Dir1),
  326:     file:del_dir(Dir2),
  327:     ok.
  328: 
  329: %% Compare contents of BEAM files having literals.
  330: cmp_literals(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  331:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  332: 
  333:     Dir1 = filename:join(PrivDir, "dir1"),
  334:     Dir2 = filename:join(PrivDir, "dir2"),
  335: 
  336:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir1),
  337:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir2),
  338: 
  339:     {SourceD1, BeamFileD1} = make_beam(Dir1, simple, constant),
  340:     {SourceD2, BeamFileD2} = make_beam(Dir2, simple, constant2),
  341: 
  342:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  343:     P0 = pps(),
  344: 
  345:     %% cmp
  346:     ok = beam_lib:cmp(BeamFileD1, BeamFileD1),
  347:     ver(chunks_different, beam_lib:cmp(BeamFileD1, BeamFileD2)),
  348: 
  349:     {ok, B1} = file:read_file(BeamFileD1),
  350:     ok = beam_lib:cmp(B1, BeamFileD1),
  351:     {ok, B2} = file:read_file(BeamFileD2),
  352:     ver(chunks_different, beam_lib:cmp(B1, B2)),
  353: 
  354:     true = (P0 == pps()),
  355:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  356: 
  357:     delete_files([SourceD1, BeamFileD1, SourceD2, BeamFileD2]),
  358: 
  359:     file:del_dir(Dir1),
  360:     file:del_dir(Dir2),
  361:     ok.
  362: 
  363: %% Strip BEAM files.
  364: strip(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  365:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  366:     {SourceD1, BeamFileD1} = make_beam(PrivDir, simple, member),
  367:     {Source2D1, BeamFile2D1} = make_beam(PrivDir, simple2, concat),
  368:     {Source3D1, BeamFile3D1} = make_beam(PrivDir, make_fun, make_fun),
  369:     {Source4D1, BeamFile4D1} = make_beam(PrivDir, constant, constant),
  370:     {Source5D1, BeamFile5D1} = make_beam(PrivDir, lines, lines),
  371: 
  372:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  373:     P0 = pps(),
  374: 
  375:     %% strip binary
  376:     verify(not_a_beam_file, beam_lib:strip(<<>>)),
  377:     {ok, B1} = file:read_file(BeamFileD1),
  378:     {ok, {simple, NB1}} = beam_lib:strip(B1),
  379:     BId1 = chunk_ids(B1),
  380:     NBId1 = chunk_ids(NB1),
  381:     true = length(BId1) > length(NBId1),
  382:     compare_chunks(B1, NB1, NBId1),
  383: 
  384:     %% strip file
  385:     verify(file_error, beam_lib:strip(foo)),
  386:     {ok, {simple, _}} = beam_lib:strip(BeamFileD1),
  387:     compare_chunks(NB1, BeamFileD1, NBId1),
  388: 
  389:     %% strip_files
  390:     {ok, B2} = file:read_file(BeamFile2D1),
  391:     {ok, [{simple,_},{simple2,_}]} = beam_lib:strip_files([B1, B2]),
  392:     {ok, [{simple,_},{simple2,_},{make_fun,_},{constant,_}]} =
  393: 	beam_lib:strip_files([BeamFileD1, BeamFile2D1, BeamFile3D1, BeamFile4D1]),
  394: 
  395:     %% strip a complex module
  396:     OrigSofsPath = code:where_is_file("sofs.beam"),
  397:     BeamFileSofs = filename:join(PrivDir,"sofs.beam"),
  398:     file:copy(OrigSofsPath, BeamFileSofs),
  399:     {ok, {sofs,_}} = beam_lib:strip(BeamFileSofs),
  400:     code:unstick_mod(sofs),
  401:     false = code:purge(sofs),
  402: 
  403:     %% check that each module can be loaded.
  404:     {module, simple} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFileD1)),
  405:     {module, simple2} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile2D1)),
  406:     {module, make_fun} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile3D1)),
  407:     {module, constant} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile4D1)),
  408:     {module, sofs} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFileSofs)),
  409: 
  410:     %% check that line number information is still present after stripping
  411:     {module, lines} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile5D1)),
  412:     Info = get_line_number_info(),
  413:     true = code:delete(lines),
  414:     false = code:purge(lines),
  415:     {ok, {lines,BeamFile5D1}} = beam_lib:strip(BeamFile5D1),
  416:     {module, lines} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile5D1)),
  417:     Info = get_line_number_info(),
  418: 
  419:     true = (P0 == pps()),
  420:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  421: 
  422:     delete_files([SourceD1, BeamFileD1,
  423: 		  Source2D1, BeamFile2D1,
  424: 		  Source3D1, BeamFile3D1,
  425: 		  Source4D1, BeamFile4D1,
  426: 		  Source5D1, BeamFile5D1,
  427:                   BeamFileSofs]),
  428: 
  429:     false = code:purge(sofs),
  430:     {module, sofs} = code:load_file(sofs),
  431:     code:stick_mod(sofs),
  432:     ok.
  433: 
  434: strip_add_chunks(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  435:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  436:     {SourceD1, BeamFileD1} = make_beam(PrivDir, simple, member),
  437:     {Source2D1, BeamFile2D1} = make_beam(PrivDir, simple2, concat),
  438:     {Source3D1, BeamFile3D1} = make_beam(PrivDir, make_fun, make_fun),
  439:     {Source4D1, BeamFile4D1} = make_beam(PrivDir, constant, constant),
  440:     {Source5D1, BeamFile5D1} = make_beam(PrivDir, lines, lines),
  441: 
  442:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  443:     P0 = pps(),
  444: 
  445:     %% strip binary
  446:     verify(not_a_beam_file, beam_lib:strip(<<>>)),
  447:     {ok, B1} = file:read_file(BeamFileD1),
  448:     {ok, {simple, NB1}} = beam_lib:strip(B1),
  449: 
  450:     BId1 = chunk_ids(B1),
  451:     NBId1 = chunk_ids(NB1),
  452:     true = length(BId1) > length(NBId1),
  453:     compare_chunks(B1, NB1, NBId1),
  454: 
  455:     %% Keep all the extra chunks
  456:     ExtraChunks = ["Abst", "Dbgi", "Attr", "CInf", "Docs", "LocT", "Atom"],
  457:     {ok, {simple, AB1}} = beam_lib:strip(B1, ExtraChunks),
  458:     ABId1 = chunk_ids(AB1),
  459:     true = length(BId1) == length(ABId1),
  460:     compare_chunks(B1, AB1, ABId1),
  461: 
  462:     %% strip file - Keep extra chunks
  463:     verify(file_error, beam_lib:strip(foo)),
  464:     {ok, {simple, _}} = beam_lib:strip(BeamFileD1, ExtraChunks),
  465:     compare_chunks(B1, BeamFileD1, ABId1),
  466: 
  467:     %% strip_files
  468:     {ok, B2} = file:read_file(BeamFile2D1),
  469:     {ok, [{simple,_},{simple2,_}]} = beam_lib:strip_files([B1, B2], ExtraChunks),
  470:     {ok, [{simple,_},{simple2,_},{make_fun,_},{constant,_}]} =
  471: 	beam_lib:strip_files([BeamFileD1, BeamFile2D1, BeamFile3D1, BeamFile4D1], ExtraChunks),
  472: 
  473:     %% strip a complex module
  474:     OrigSofsPath = code:where_is_file("sofs.beam"),
  475:     BeamFileSofs = filename:join(PrivDir,"sofs.beam"),
  476:     file:copy(OrigSofsPath, BeamFileSofs),
  477:     {ok, {sofs,_}} = beam_lib:strip(BeamFileSofs, ExtraChunks),
  478:     code:unstick_mod(sofs),
  479:     false = code:purge(sofs),
  480: 
  481:     %% check that each module can be loaded.
  482:     {module, simple} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFileD1)),
  483:     {module, simple2} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile2D1)),
  484:     {module, make_fun} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile3D1)),
  485:     {module, constant} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile4D1)),
  486:     {module, sofs} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFileSofs)),
  487: 
  488:     %% check that line number information is still present after stripping
  489:     {module, lines} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile5D1)),
  490:     Info = get_line_number_info(),
  491:     false = code:purge(lines),
  492:     true = code:delete(lines),
  493:     {ok, {lines,BeamFile5D1}} = beam_lib:strip(BeamFile5D1),
  494:     {module, lines} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile5D1)),
  495:     Info = get_line_number_info(),
  496: 
  497:     true = (P0 == pps()),
  498:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  499: 
  500:     delete_files([SourceD1, BeamFileD1,
  501: 		  Source2D1, BeamFile2D1,
  502: 		  Source3D1, BeamFile3D1,
  503: 		  Source4D1, BeamFile4D1,
  504: 		  Source5D1, BeamFile5D1,
  505:                   BeamFileSofs]),
  506: 
  507:     false = code:purge(sofs),
  508:     {module, sofs} = code:load_file(sofs),
  509:     code:stick_mod(sofs),
  510: 
  511:     ok.
  512: 
  513: otp_6711(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  514:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch {a, beam_lib:info(3)}),
  515:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch {a, beam_lib:chunks(a, b)}),
  516:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch {a, beam_lib:chunks(a,b,c)}),
  517:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch {a, beam_lib:all_chunks(3)}),
  518:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch {a, beam_lib:cmp(3,4)}),
  519:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch {a, beam_lib:strip(3)}),
  520:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} =
  521:         (catch {a, beam_lib:strip_files([3])}),
  522: 
  523:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  524:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "dir"),
  525:     Lib = filename:join(Dir, "lib"),
  526:     App = filename:join(Lib, "app"),
  527:     EBin = filename:join(App, "ebin"),
  528: 
  529:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  530:     ok = file:make_dir(Lib),
  531:     ok = file:make_dir(App),
  532:     ok = file:make_dir(EBin),
  533: 
  534:     {SourceD, BeamFileD} = make_beam(EBin, simple, member),
  535: 
  536:     unwritable(BeamFileD),
  537: 
  538:     %% There is no way that strip_release can fail with
  539:     %% function_clause or something like that...
  540:     {error,_,{file_error,_,_}} = beam_lib:strip_release(Dir),
  541: 
  542:     delete_files([SourceD, BeamFileD]),
  543:     file:del_dir(EBin),
  544:     file:del_dir(App),
  545:     file:del_dir(Lib),
  546:     file:del_dir(Dir),
  547:     ok.
  548: 
  549: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
  550: 
  551: unwritable(Fname) ->
  552:     {ok, Info} = file:read_file_info(Fname),
  553:     Mode = Info#file_info.mode - 8#00200,
  554:     file:write_file_info(Fname, Info#file_info{mode = Mode}).
  555: 
  556: %% Testing building of BEAM files.
  557: building(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  558:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  559: 
  560:     Dir1 = filename:join(PrivDir, "b_dir1"),
  561:     Dir2 = filename:join(PrivDir, "b_dir2"),
  562: 
  563:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir1),
  564:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir2),
  565: 
  566:     {SourceD1, BeamFileD1} = make_beam(Dir1, building, member),
  567: 
  568:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  569:     P0 = pps(),
  570: 
  571:     %% read all chunks
  572:     ChunkIds = chunk_ids(BeamFileD1),
  573:     {ok, _Mod, Chunks} = beam_lib:all_chunks(BeamFileD1),
  574:     ChunkIds = lists:map(fun ({Id, Data}) when is_binary(Data) -> Id
  575: 			 end, Chunks),
  576: 
  577:     %% write a new beam file, with reversed chunk order
  578:     BeamFileD2 = filename:join(Dir2, "building.beam"),
  579:     {ok,RevBeam} = beam_lib:build_module(lists:reverse(Chunks)),
  580:     file:write_file(BeamFileD2, RevBeam),
  581: 
  582:     %% compare files
  583:     compare_chunks(BeamFileD1, BeamFileD2, ChunkIds),
  584: 
  585:     %% test that we can retrieve a chunk before the atom table
  586:     %% (actually, try to retrieve all chunks)
  587: 
  588:     lists:foreach(fun(Id) ->
  589: 			  {ok, {building, [{Id, _Data}]}} =
  590: 			      beam_lib:chunks(BeamFileD1, [Id])
  591: 		  end, ChunkIds),
  592:     lists:foreach(fun(Id) ->
  593: 			  {ok, {building, [{Id, _Data}]}} =
  594: 			      beam_lib:chunks(BeamFileD2, [Id])
  595: 		  end, ChunkIds),
  596: 
  597:     true = (P0 == pps()),
  598:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  599: 
  600:     delete_files([SourceD1, BeamFileD1, BeamFileD2]),
  601:     file:del_dir(Dir1),
  602:     file:del_dir(Dir2),
  603:     ok.
  604: 
  605: %% Compare beam_lib:md5/1 and code:module_md5/1.
  606: md5(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  607:     Beams = collect_beams(),
  608:     io:format("Found ~w beam files", [length(Beams)]),
  609:     md5_1(Beams).
  610: 
  611: md5_1([N|Ns]) ->
  612:     {ok,Beam0} = file:read_file(N),
  613:     Beam = maybe_uncompress(Beam0),
  614:     {ok,{Mod,MD5}} = beam_lib:md5(Beam),
  615:     {Mod,MD5} = {Mod,code:module_md5(Beam)},
  616:     md5_1(Ns);
  617: md5_1([]) -> ok.
  618: 
  619: collect_beams() ->
  620:     SuperDir = filename:dirname(filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))),
  621:     TestDirs = filelib:wildcard(filename:join([SuperDir,"*_test"])),
  622:     AbsDirs = [filename:absname(X) || X <- code:get_path()],
  623:     collect_beams_1(AbsDirs ++ TestDirs).
  624: 
  625: collect_beams_1([Dir|Dirs]) ->
  626:     filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Dir, "*.beam")) ++ collect_beams_1(Dirs);
  627: collect_beams_1([]) -> [].
  628: 
  629: maybe_uncompress(<<"FOR1",_/binary>>=Beam) -> Beam;
  630: maybe_uncompress(Beam) -> zlib:gunzip(Beam).
  631: 
  632: %% Test encrypted abstract format.
  633: encrypted_abstr(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  634:     run_if_crypto_works(fun() -> encrypted_abstr_1(Conf) end).
  635: 
  636: encrypted_abstr_1(Conf) ->
  637:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  638:     Simple = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple"),
  639:     Source = Simple ++ ".erl",
  640:     BeamFile = Simple ++ ".beam",
  641:     simple_file(Source),
  642: 
  643:     %% Avoid getting an extra port when crypto starts erl_ddll.
  644:     erl_ddll:start(),
  645: 
  646:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  647:     P0 = pps(),
  648: 
  649:     Key = "#a_crypto_key",
  650:     CompileFlags = [{outdir,PrivDir}, debug_info, {debug_info_key,Key}],
  651:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Source, CompileFlags),
  652:     {ok, Binary} = file:read_file(BeamFile),
  653: 
  654:     do_encrypted_abstr(BeamFile, Key),
  655:     do_encrypted_abstr(Binary, Key),
  656: 
  657:     ok = crypto:stop(),			%To get rid of extra ets tables.
  658:     file:delete(BeamFile),
  659:     file:delete(Source),
  660:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  661:     true = (P0 == pps()),
  662:     ok.
  663: 
  664: do_encrypted_abstr(Beam, Key) ->
  665:     verify(key_missing_or_invalid, beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [debug_info])),
  666: 
  667:     %% The raw chunk "Dbgi" can still be read even without a key.
  668:     {ok,{simple,[{"Dbgi",Dbgi}]}} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, ["Dbgi"]),
  669:     <<0:8,8:8,"des3_cbc",_/binary>> = Dbgi,
  670: 
  671:     %% Try som invalid funs.
  672:     bad_fun(badfun, fun() -> ok end),
  673:     bad_fun(badfun, {a,b}),
  674:     bad_fun(blurf),
  675:     {function_clause,_} = bad_fun(fun(glurf) -> ok end),
  676: 
  677:     %% Funs that return something strange.
  678:     bad_fun(badfun, fun(init) -> {ok,fun() -> ok end} end),
  679:     glurf = bad_fun(fun(init) -> {error,glurf} end),
  680: 
  681:     %% Try clearing (non-existing fun).
  682:     undefined = beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  683: 
  684:     %% Install a fun which cannot retrieve a key.
  685:     ok = beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(fun(init) -> ok end),
  686:     {error,beam_lib,Error} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
  687: 
  688:     %% Install a fun which returns an incorrect key.
  689:     {ok,_} = beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  690:     ok = beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(simple_crypto_fun("wrong key...")),
  691:     {error,beam_lib,Error} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
  692: 
  693:     %% Installing a new key fun is not possible without clearing the old.
  694:     verify(exists, beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(simple_crypto_fun(Key))),
  695: 
  696:     %% Install the simplest possible working key fun.
  697:     {ok,_} = beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  698:     ok = beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(simple_crypto_fun(Key)),
  699:     verify_abstract(Beam),
  700:     {ok,{simple,[{"Dbgi",Dbgi}]}} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, ["Dbgi"]),
  701: 
  702:     %% Installing a new key fun is not possible without clearing the old.
  703:     verify(exists, beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(ets_crypto_fun(Key))),
  704: 
  705:     %% Install a key using an ets table.
  706:     {ok,_} = beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  707:     ok = beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(ets_crypto_fun(Key)),
  708:     verify_abstract(Beam),
  709:     {ok,{simple,[{"Dbgi",Dbgi}]}} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, ["Dbgi"]),
  710: 
  711:     {ok,cleared} = beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  712: 
  713:     %% Try to force a stop/start race.
  714:     start_stop_race(10000),
  715: 
  716:     ok.
  717: 
  718: start_stop_race(0) ->
  719:     ok;
  720: start_stop_race(N) ->
  721:     {error,_} = beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(bad_fun),
  722:     undefined = beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  723:     start_stop_race(N-1).
  724: 
  725: bad_fun(F) ->
  726:     {error,E} = beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(F),
  727:     E.
  728: 
  729: bad_fun(S, F) ->
  730:     verify(S, beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(F)).
  731: 
  732: verify_abstract(Beam) ->
  733:     {ok,{simple,[Abst, Dbgi]}} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code, debug_info]),
  734:     {abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,_}} = Abst,
  735:     {debug_info,{debug_info_v1,erl_abstract_code,_}} = Dbgi.
  736: 
  737: simple_crypto_fun(Key) ->
  738:     fun(init) -> ok;
  739:        ({debug_info, des3_cbc, simple, _}) -> Key
  740:     end.
  741: 
  742: ets_crypto_fun(Key) ->
  743:     fun(init) ->
  744: 	    T = ets:new(beam_lib_SUITE_keys, [private, set]),
  745: 	    true = ets:insert(T, {key,Key}),
  746: 	    {ok,fun({debug_info, des3_cbc, simple, _}) ->
  747: 			[{key,Val}] = ets:lookup(T, key),
  748: 			Val;
  749: 		   (clear) ->
  750: 			ets:delete(T),
  751: 			cleared
  752: 		end}
  753:     end.
  754: 
  755: %% Test encrypted abstract format with the key in .erlang.crypt.
  756: encrypted_abstr_file(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  757:     run_if_crypto_works(fun() -> encrypted_abstr_file_1(Conf) end).
  758: 
  759: encrypted_abstr_file_1(Conf) ->
  760:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  761:     Simple = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple"),
  762:     Source = Simple ++ ".erl",
  763:     BeamFile = Simple ++ ".beam",
  764:     simple_file(Source),
  765: 
  766:     %% Avoid getting an extra port when crypto starts erl_ddll.
  767:     erl_ddll:start(),
  768: 
  769:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  770:     P0 = pps(),
  771: 
  772:     Key = "Long And niCe 99Krypto Key",
  773:     CompileFlags = [{outdir,PrivDir}, debug_info, {debug_info_key,Key}],
  774:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Source, CompileFlags),
  775:     {ok, Binary} = file:read_file(BeamFile),
  776: 
  777:     {ok,OldCwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  778:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  779:     do_encrypted_abstr_file(BeamFile, Key),
  780:     do_encrypted_abstr_file(Binary, Key),
  781:     ok = file:set_cwd(OldCwd),
  782: 
  783:     ok = crypto:stop(),			%To get rid of extra ets tables.
  784:     file:delete(filename:join(PrivDir, ".erlang.crypt")),
  785:     file:delete(BeamFile),
  786:     file:delete(Source),
  787:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  788:     true = (P0 == pps()),
  789:     ok.
  790: 
  791: do_encrypted_abstr_file(Beam, Key) ->
  792:     %% No key.
  793:     write_crypt_file(""),
  794:     {error,beam_lib,Error} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
  795: 
  796:     %% A wrong key.
  797:     write_crypt_file(["[{debug_info,des3_cbc,simple,\"A Wrong Key\"}].\n"]),
  798:     {error,beam_lib,Error} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
  799: 
  800:     %% Write correct key...
  801:     write_crypt_file(["[{debug_info,des3_cbc,simple,\"",Key,"\"}].\n"]),
  802: 
  803:     %% ... but the fun with the wrong key is still there.
  804:     {error,beam_lib,Error} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
  805: 
  806:     %% Clear the fun. Now it should work.
  807:     {ok,_} = beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  808:     verify_abstract(Beam),
  809:     verify_abstract(Beam),
  810:     ok = file:delete(".erlang.crypt"),
  811:     verify_abstract(Beam),
  812: 
  813:     %% Clear, otherwise the second pass will fail.
  814:     {ok,_} = beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  815:     {error,beam_lib,Error} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
  816:     ok.
  817: 
  818: test_makedep_abstract_code(Conf) ->
  819:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  820:     ErlFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "hello.erl"),
  821:     BeamFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "hello.beam"),
  822:     file:write_file(ErlFile,
  823: 		    ["-module(hello).\n",
  824: 		     "-export([start/0]).\n",
  825: 		     "start() -> ok.\n"
  826: 		    ]),
  827:     DependDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "depend"),
  828:     file:make_dir(DependDir),
  829:     DependFile = filename:join(DependDir,"hello.d"),
  830:     compile:file(ErlFile,
  831: 		 [debug_info,
  832: 		  makedep_side_effect,
  833: 		  {outdir, PrivDir},
  834: 		  {makedep_output, DependFile}]),
  835:     file:delete(DependFile),
  836:     file:del_dir(DependDir),
  837:     case beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [debug_info]) of
  838: 	{ok, {Module, [{debug_info, {debug_info_v1,
  839: 				     _Backend=erl_abstract_code,Metadata}}]}} ->
  840: 	    SrcOpts = [no_copt, to_core, binary, return_errors,
  841: 		       no_inline, strict_record_tests, strict_record_updates,
  842: 		       dialyzer, no_spawn_compiler_process],
  843: 	    {ok,_} = erl_abstract_code:debug_info(core_v1, Module, Metadata,
  844: 						  SrcOpts),
  845:             ok
  846:     end.
  847:     
  848: 
  849: write_crypt_file(Contents0) ->
  850:     Contents = list_to_binary([Contents0]),
  851:     io:format("~s\n", [binary_to_list(Contents)]),
  852:     ok = file:write_file(".erlang.crypt", Contents).
  853: 
  854: %% GH-4353: Don't crash when the backend for generating the abstract code
  855: %% is missing.
  856: missing_debug_info_backend(Conf) ->
  857:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  858:     Simple = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple"),
  859:     Source = Simple ++ ".erl",
  860:     BeamFile = Simple ++ ".beam",
  861:     simple_file(Source),
  862: 
  863:     %% Create a debug_info chunk with a non-existing backend.
  864:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Source, [{outdir,PrivDir}]),
  865:     {ok,simple,All0} = beam_lib:all_chunks(BeamFile),
  866:     FakeBackend = definitely__not__an__existing__backend,
  867:     FakeDebugInfo = {debug_info_v1, FakeBackend, nothing_here},
  868:     All = lists:keyreplace("Dbgi", 1, All0, {"Dbgi", term_to_binary(FakeDebugInfo)}),
  869:     {ok,NewBeam} = beam_lib:build_module(All),
  870:     ok = file:write_file(BeamFile, NewBeam),
  871: 
  872:     %% beam_lib should not crash, but return an error.
  873:     verify(missing_backend, beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [abstract_code])),
  874:     file:delete(BeamFile),
  875: 
  876:     ok.
  877: 
  878: compare_chunks(File1, File2, ChunkIds) ->
  879:     {ok, {_, Chunks1}} = beam_lib:chunks(File1, ChunkIds),
  880:     {ok, {_, Chunks2}} = beam_lib:chunks(File2, ChunkIds),
  881:     true = Chunks1 == Chunks2.
  882: 
  883: chunk_ids(File) ->
  884:     lists:map(fun({Id,_Start,_Size}) -> Id end, chunk_info(File)).
  885: 
  886: chunk_info(File) ->
  887:     {value, {chunks, Chunks}} =
  888: 	lists:keysearch(chunks, 1, beam_lib:info(File)),
  889:     Chunks.
  890: 
  891: make_beam(Dir, Module, F) ->
  892:     FileBase = filename:join(Dir, atom_to_list(Module)),
  893:     Source = FileBase ++ ".erl",
  894:     BeamFile = FileBase ++ ".beam",
  895:     file:delete(BeamFile),
  896:     simple_file(Source, Module, F),
  897:     {ok, _} = compile:file(Source, [{outdir,Dir}, debug_info, report]),
  898:     {Source, BeamFile}.
  899: 
  900: set_byte(_Backup, Binary, Pos, Byte) when is_binary(Binary) ->
  901:     <<B1:Pos/binary, _:1/binary, B2/binary>> = Binary,
  902:     NB = <<B1/binary, Byte:8, B2/binary>>,
  903:     NB;
  904: set_byte(Backup, File, Pos, Byte) ->
  905:     copy_file(Backup, File),
  906:     set_byte(File, Pos, Byte),
  907:     File.
  908: 
  909: set_byte(File, Pos, Byte) ->
  910:     {ok, Fd} = file:open(File, [read, write]),
  911:     {ok, _} = file:position(Fd, Pos),
  912:     ok = file:write(Fd, [Byte]),
  913:     file:close(Fd).
  914: 
  915: copy_file(Src, Dest) ->
  916:     {ok, _} = file:copy(Src, Dest),
  917:     ok = file:change_mode(Dest, 8#0666).
  918: 
  919: delete_files(Files) ->
  920:     lists:foreach(fun(F) -> file:delete(F) end, Files).
  921: 
  922: verify(S, {error, beam_lib, R}) ->
  923:     verify_error(S, R);
  924: verify(S, {error, R}) ->
  925:     verify_error(S, R).
  926: 
  927: verify_error(S, R) ->
  928:     if
  929: 	S =:= R -> ok;
  930: 	true -> [S|_] = tuple_to_list(R)
  931:     end,
  932: 
  933:     %% Most formatted messages begin with "./simple.beam:" or "<<...".
  934:     FM = string:str(lists:flatten(beam_lib:format_error(R)), "simpl") > 0,
  935:     BM = string:str(lists:flatten(beam_lib:format_error(R)), "<<") > 0,
  936: 
  937:     %% Also make sure that formatted message is not just the term printed.
  938:     Handled = beam_lib:format_error(R) =/= io_lib:format("~p~n", [R]),
  939:     true = ((FM > 0) or (BM > 0)) and Handled.
  940: 
  941: ver(S, {error, beam_lib, R}) ->
  942:     [S|_] = tuple_to_list(R),
  943:     case lists:flatten(beam_lib:format_error(R)) of
  944: 	[${ | _] ->
  945: 	    ct:fail({bad_format_error, R});
  946: 	_ ->
  947: 	    ok
  948:     end.
  949: 
  950: pps() ->
  951:     {erlang:ports()}.
  952: 
  953: simple_file(File) ->
  954:     simple_file(File, simple).
  955: 
  956: simple_file(File, Module) ->
  957:     simple_file(File, Module, member).
  958: 
  959: simple_file(File, Module, make_fun) ->
  960:     B = list_to_binary(["-module(", atom_to_list(Module), "). "
  961: 			"-export([t/1]). "
  962: 			"t(A) -> "
  963: 			"    fun(X) -> A+X end. "]),
  964:     ok = file:write_file(File, B);
  965: simple_file(File, Module, constant) ->
  966:     B = list_to_binary(["-module(", atom_to_list(Module), "). "
  967: 			"-export([t/1]). "
  968: 			"t(A) -> "
  969: 			"    {a,b,[2,3],c,d}. "]),
  970:     ok = file:write_file(File, B);
  971: simple_file(File, Module, constant2) ->
  972:     B = list_to_binary(["-module(", atom_to_list(Module), "). "
  973: 			"-export([t/1]). "
  974: 			"t(A) -> "
  975: 			"    {a,b,[2,3],x,y}. "]),
  976:     ok = file:write_file(File, B);
  977: simple_file(File, Module, lines) ->
  978:     B = list_to_binary(["-module(", atom_to_list(Module), ").\n"
  979: 			"-export([t/1]).\n"
  980: 			"t(A) ->\n"
  981: 			"    A+1.\n"]),
  982:     ok = file:write_file(File, B);
  983: simple_file(File, Module, F) ->
  984:     B = list_to_binary(["-module(", atom_to_list(Module), "). "
  985: 			"-export([t/0]). "
  986: 			"t() -> "
  987: 			"    t([]). "
  988: 			"t(L) -> "
  989: 			"    lists:", 
  990: 			atom_to_list(F), "(a, L). "]),
  991:     ok = file:write_file(File, B).
  992: 
  993: run_if_crypto_works(Test) ->
  994:     try	begin crypto:start(), crypto:stop(), ok end of
  995: 	ok ->
  996: 	    Test()
  997:     catch
  998: 	error:_ ->
  999: 	    {skip,"The crypto application is missing or broken"}
 1000:     end.
 1001: 
 1002: get_line_number_info() ->
 1003:     %% The stacktrace for operators such a '+' can vary depending on
 1004:     %% whether the JIT is used or not.
 1005:     case catch lines:t(atom) of
 1006:         {'EXIT',{badarith,[{erlang,'+',[atom,1],_},
 1007:                            {lines,t,1,Info}|_]}} ->
 1008:             Info;
 1009:         {'EXIT',{badarith,[{lines,t,1,Info}|_]}} ->
 1010:             Info
 1011:     end.
